definition: flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Disappointments are likely if your mate embarrasses you in front of friends. Partners may try to argue with you;
sentences.chinese: 如果伴侣让你在朋友面前丢面子你会感到很失望。

sentences.english: Many agreed that the Prime Minister had in effect resigned dishonorably.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为首相辞职实际上是很丢面子的。

sentences.english: Getting angry or raising your voice will create only an ugly, face-losing situation for all.
sentences.chinese: 表现出愤怒和提高音量只会导致丢面子的结果。

sentences.english: Worst of all were the humiliations.
Now, Sex has been very embarrassing to me.
sentences.chinese: 现在，性生活让我丢面子了。

sentences.english: Disappointments are likely if your mate embarrasses you in front of friends.
sentences.chinese: 如果伴侣让你在朋友面前丢面子你会感到很失望。

sentences.english: He knew he was wrong, but he would not admit it, for fear of losing face.
sentences.chinese: 他知道他错了，但是不愿意承认，怕丢面子。

definition: to be unable to extricate oneself gracefully/to be put on the spot/to be embarrassed
lit. for one's face to reach rock bottom/to be thoroughly discredited (idiom)
to be put on the spot/to find oneself in an awkward situation
see 愛面子|爱面子[ai4 mian4 zi5]
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
shameful/scandalous/to be humiliated/to make a fool of sb or oneself/to make sb lose face
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
